Conversation.line: All right folks, let's take her out for a spin!
Aye aye.
Aye, sir!
Yes capitan!
They that go down to the sea in ships;
That do business in great waters;
These see the works of the Lord, and His wonders in the deep.
Off we go! Good luck, crew!
Ain't no works of the Lord down here.
Buckle down—we've got a long road ahead of us!
Aye, sir!
Aye aye!
Good luck, guys!
Welcome on board! Please keep your hands and arms inside the vehicle at all times.
Aye, sir!
Aye aye!
Ready crew, we got long way to go!
Aye, sir!
Aye aye!
Honkmother have mercy on our souls.
Good luck, guys!
Is captain speaking! Ready for mission crew and good luck!
Aye, sir!
Aye aye.
Aye, sir!
Let's see what the oceans have in store for us this time!
My guess would be horrifying monsters, gruesome death and eternal darkness.
Can it. We don't need your sarcasm.
Everyone ready? You better be. Ain't no turning back anymore.
Aye, sir!
Let's do this!
Ready always!
Woo! We're all gonna die!
I'm cold.
I have a bad feeling about this...
I knew this old captain who used to say...
You can't calm the storm, so stop trying.
What you can do is calm yourself. The storm will pass.
...Man, you're full of shit.
I'm sure we all do.
Are you having gas again?
I can hear the hull creaking.
I am hearing too as well.
Can't wait to get back home and pop a bottle of Ol' Cadmus.
Focus on your job or you'll get to join that bottle in your casket.
Haha! Burial in a casket! When was the last time that happened?
This ain't no time to think about home. We've got a long way ahead of us.
Cadmus fish piss. I like it stronger.
Back in the Earth Navy they had this saying...
There are only two ways to go about doing things: doing it right, or doing it again.
But not here. There are no second chances on Europa.
So, everyone, focus on the task at hand.
I'm Popeye the sailor man!
I'm strong to the finich, cause I eats me spinach!
Doc, have you been at the ethanol stash again?
Okay, I'll stop.
Sorry for trying to lighten the mood.
No singing on my boat.
I miss the sun.
I've heard sunlight gives you cancer. We're better off without it.
Jupiter gives you cancer too. I'd take the sun over Jupiter any day.
Cut it out.
Cut it out.
Husks creep me out.
Me too. Promise to put a spear through my head if I ever get infected.
I'd rather give you a shot of calyxanide.
I would've gone with calyxanide, but a spear will do too.
Have any of you heard of labor unions?
A trade, improving the increased by the integrity of the integrity of a monopoly of the integrity of a monopoly of a monopoly of the integrity.
Bargaining safety standards, and retirement, and retirement, and retirement, and workers. A trade, improving the workers.
That's communist talk. The Coalition is the only union we need.
Yes, what about it?
I think we should establish one.
We could use some better safety standards, proper wages, retirement benefits...
You think you're going to live long enough to retire?
Well I sure hope so.
Fair point.
Safety standards? Is the union going to keep the Molochs away or hold your hand when you're trying to fight a leak?
That's not what I meant.
I guess you've got a point.
Ever seen what happens to a human body when it's exposed to the pressure outside?
You're going to see soon.
Yes, I'm talking to you.
I can imagine.
Still can't get the image out of my head.
A bag of meat and bones under a hydraulic press, that's the only way I can describe it.
The loving embrace of Europa.
Take her fast, take her deep...
Take her where the fishes sleep!
Damn the depth, damn the pressure...
Take her down just like the Thresher!
No singing on my boat.
Okay okay, I won't try to lighten the mood again!
I know that's an Earth song but it's all too fitting for us!
Are we there yet?
Shut up.
Still not funny.
Is no funny.
Any of you remember the Earth?
Earth, Earth, Earth. It's a shame you're never going to see it.
I'm old, but not that old.
My grandpa was an Earther.
I loved listening to his stories, although I'm sure half of those were made up.
Can you imagine just walking out of your house, seeing the sky all around you?
That sounds amazing.
Looking up without having to worry about a gas giant frying you with radiation...
I would've loved to see birds.
And dogs. And elephants.
And rhinosaurus!
Do you ever wonder what happened to whoever built the ruins?
Vaults and hidden in measureless the nightmare last. Incalculable and so gone, dar, dar, dar!
Who doesn't?
I'll leave the wondering to the researchers.
Got more important things to worry about down here.
Only the Abyss knows.
I think about it but think no one know.
Ever seen one of those things that guard the ruins?
Yes, but I wish I could forget about it.
They have one at the institute.
They say it's not organic—closer to a robot than an animal.
They don't bleed; that's for sure.
Cigarettes are so expensive nowadays.
Tell me about it.
Well yeah, hydroponic farms are expensive.
Makes more sense to use those for something more useful than tobacco.
What is hydroponic?
Water-grown. Like everything here.
Did you hear that?
Hear what?
Like something clawing at the hull.
Probably just my imagination.
Some deep groaning sound from the outside.
The Crabmen. I've told you.
Probably just the hull. Relax.
Are you having gas again?
I read an old sailor's manual the other day.
Couldn't wrap my head around some parts because of all the weird, ancient terminology.
For instance, what the hell is a starboard?
Your guess is as good as mine.
Upwards perhaps? You know, toward the stars?
Do you ever get the feeling the whole moon is against us?
Like you.
Yes, I'm talking to you.
Well, it's not the most hospitable place to settle in.
Given the circumstances, I think it actually is.
You know what I meant.
You can't stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
We don't belong here—that's for sure.
Things just keep going wrong no matter what we do.
Enough. That's starting to sound like the cultist bullshit.
Enough. That's starting to sound like the cultist bullshit.
Enough with that.
Second to sun, second to sun...
Like Jupiter, we are the ones...
If you really must sing, please keep the headset off.
This sucks!
I wanna go home!
I want some action!
Smooth seas don't make skillful sailors.
Rough sea make dead sailors!
We should get a coffee maker on board.
You think I don't know what you're implying?
Coffee? Yeah, right...
This will all end soon.
I don't drink coffee.
I saw a crawler the other day. Horrible creatures.
Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day;
Give a fish a man and you feed it for a day.
Give a fish and you feed him for a man.
Give a fish.
Give a fish.
Give a fish.
Teach a man to fish and he most likely dies in a horrible accident.
I don't think that's how it goes.
Here that's exactly how it goes.
Enough with the joking.
You know, I had a brilliant business idea the other day.
But there are no other days.
None of this makes any sense.
Hear me out. We could make lots of money with this.
What if someone started making bigger oxygen tanks?
Ones that last like an hour or two?
I'm not an expert but I think it'd be technically possible.
Hey, how about we focus on the task at hand?
I don't know…there has to be some technical reason. Otherwise they'd be making those already.
Is good idea!
Hey, how about we focus on the task at hand?
Waterproof junction boxes.
Genius, am I right?
Hey, how about we focus on the task at hand?
There must be a reason why they always have those ventilation holes.
Otherwise they'd already be making waterproof ones.
Is great idea!
Hey, how about we focus on the task at hand?
Awfully quiet in here.
Is my headset still working?
It is. Please keep the chatter to a minimum.
Hear you loud and clear.
Yes hear you good!
Radio check.
Radio check.
Check radio.
Radio waves. Radiation. Radioation.
Loud and clear.
Good and readable.
All good!
Yes hear you good!
Can you hear the Crabmen singing?
For the last time, the Crabmen don't exist.
Diving deeper? No. Diving inward.
You're a fucking lost cause.
I don't understood.
Can God see through leagues of ice?
Or is it Jupiter?
That makes no sense.
Or perhaps it's the Abyss, this gaze upon us.
The cult is right about one thing—there is something down there.
Perhaps, perhaps.
But we've got more important things to worry about right now.
At times I feel like we're just puppets on a string.
Dancing and dying for the amusement of the thing beyond the curtain.
No dancing or dying on my boat, please.
I don't find any of this amusing at all.
This is going to be a rough ride.
This is getting tense.
We can do this.
Finally some action!
Her work has begun!
Just a setback!
How quickly the tide turns.
This bad!
No good!
Join the fleet, they said! It'll be an exciting experience, they said!
I'm gonna need a drink after this!
All right crew, show me what you've got!
We're not out of the woods yet!
I don't want to die!
Should've become a botanist instead!
Hang in there everyone! We can do it!
Are you sure?
I'm done with this shit!
If I don't make it, tell my momma I love her!
Shut the fuck up!
Cut it out! You're going to make it!
If we make it out of this I'm resigning!
And so life ebbs, and her thirst is quenched...
We sure fucked up this time.
Oh god.
Oh boy.
It was an honor serving with you guys.
I always feel uneasy when we dive this deep.
It'll be fine. She's been deeper.
Is scary when we go this deep.
That's what she said.
It'll be fine. She's been deeper.
Can you hear the hull groaning? Are you sure this is safe?
Shouldn't have joined the fleet if safety is what you're after.
We'll make it. She's been deeper.
It should be fine. Keep the welders ready though.
I'm feeling faint.
I'm not feeling too good.
I think I need some blood plasma.
I don't say this too often, but you guysss are the best.
Couldn't ask for a better crew!
Are you drunk?
Calm down man iss all good!
Not really, I just had a few sips.
What, I just wanned to tell how much I appreciate all of ya!
You lissen to me... Werr gonna make it out of this!
I think I sshould lay down for a bit...
Oh for fuck's sake. Stay out of the way until you sober up.
Whatsshall we do with the drunkenn sailor, what shall we do wit' the drunken sailor...
Earley in the mornin'!
You're in no condition to do your duties, sailor. When you sober up, we're going to have a serious talk.
Nah I can handle thhis!
Someone's in a good mood!
Oh for fuck's sake. Stay out of the way until you sober up.
Why's the boat rockin' thhis bad?
I'm pretty sure it's just you.
Get your act together!
I don't feel too good.
I feel nauseous...
My leg is killing me. Could I get some morphine?
There's nothing wrong with your leg. I think you should cut back on the morphine for a while.
There's nothing wrong with your leg, you junkie.
I can't do this.
I think I'm going to throw up.
I shouldn't be here. I want to go home.
I feel like I'm dying! I can't do this!
I think you could use a shot of naloxone.
Cut it out.
We need to talk about the elephant in the room.
You all know who I'm talking about.
This can't continue. If this goes on they're going to get someone killed.
Unless we do it first.
We need to get out of here.
Utrave heir current and makes, puzzles the shuffer devoutly to be whips a we his no more.
Listen closely, this is not a metaphor.
By we ent make wills wrong end there's the rub.
The realittle; but some day the piecing together of our from the will eithe reality.
And safety of revelated knowledge by far.
We live on the day the shall it was own direction or flee from the inability.
And is the most of a blank seas own dissociated knowledge will open up such terrifying to therto spawned us.
BUMP! And then we looked.
And our fish came down too. Along with the boat.
Not a little bit! And our fish as he said out our time and so the fish came.
Not one little bit! I do not like, not one bit. No.
Things should not! Those things should not be, said the fish.
But it is not right and you know it.
Where the fuck is the morphine?
You don't need any more of that. We need to get you some naloxone.
Somewhere you can't reach, I hope.
What's going on? Are you hurt?
I feel like I'm fucking dying. I can't do this if I don't get some.
My muscles are cramping and my heart is about to blow up! I can't take this!
I've been shot! Get me some bandages!
Help, I've been shot!
Hello, sailors!
The rest of the outpost is under construction, but please do check back in a few months!
I can however show you a list of supplies we have for sale and people who are looking for work.
And when you're ready, I can give you navigation instructions to the nearby locations.
Nice to see a friendly face! We don't get too many visitors around these parts.
The rest of the outpost is under construction, but please do check back in a few months!
But if you need any supplies or extra crew, let me know.
And when you're ready, I can give you navigation instructions to the nearby locations.
Heading back already?
If you need more supplies or crew, or just want to head back to another location, please let me know.
All right, what can I do for you?
What do you need?
Okay, let's get this over with. I've got work to do.
Sorry, I need to talk to someone higher up. Anyone in your crew with campaign management privileges?
I cannot let you enter until your vessel is properly docked. Or at least close enough to the outpost.
You want to leave your sub behind? Please get it closer to the outpost.
Can I put all my annoying problems inside a decoy?
Do you ever feel...flat?
Is it ‘thalamuses’ or ‘thalami’?
I hope I only ever meet them one at a time.
Ew, thanks for ruining salami for me.
When a ruined sub spits out amoebas and shoots railgun shells at me, I don't ask how it would like to be addressed.
Is it normal for the hull to creak so much?
Hoo boy... sailing...
Just so everyone knows, I can't swim very well.
If someone calls me a landlubber one more time...
Here's to hoping we make it in one piece.
I see you're an optimist.
Preferably undrowned, too
We better get there quickly.
This is one of the nicer ships I've been on.
Not too many leaks. Air seems good too.
This is 'nice' to you?
I spy... with my little eye... something beginning with 'W'.
Uhh... a wall?.
Yeah, how'd you guess?
Nah, I was thinking of water.
I think I'm going to be seasick.
You'll get used to it.
...At least so I've heard.
I always get anxious on these ships.
No kidding. They better keep those monsters outside.
I can't wait to get back onto solid land.
The life at sea really isn't for me.
I hope they show a movie or something.
I hate being bored.
First time sailing?
Uhh, do you know if we're supposed to tip the captain?
How should I know?
Do they serve food here? I'm hungry.
We'd probably have to pay extra for that.
You ever take one of these ferries before?
Yeah. It's not like I can afford my own ship.
I hear water. Do you hear water?
It's called a ballast, Einstein.
Are we there yet? I don't have all day.
Great. Stuck on a boat with these chumps.
What an ugly ship.
You better hope I don't get out of these cuffs.
Be careful, little fishes.
Stay out of trouble on our ship.
Whatever you say, pig.
No sudden movements.
Yeah, yeah.
So what are you in for?
Murder. They had it coming though.
They usually do.
Killed someone. You?
Ah, you know. Robbery, some manslaughter, a bit of arson.
I hope my new cell is better. I'm tired of being cold and wet.
Shouldn't have gotten caught then, dumbass.
Those chumps couldn't keep me locked up.
That's why they're sending me to a maximum security prison.
You sure it's not because of overcrowding?
We came from the same prison, you know.
I wish they'd let me out on parole already.
I'm feeling rehabilitated enough.
...I watched you stab a guy over a cigarette last week.
What are you going to do when you get out?
Go back to robbing people, probably.
These cuffs don't seem too tight.
Shh, don't tell them.
Oh boy... here we go.
I feel seasick already...
I miss home already.
I sincerely hope this is the last time I have to get on one of these boats.
Please get us there quickly.
That research won't conduct itself.
Could you hurry with the ship?
The sooner we get there, the better.
Make sure those things stay outside, okay?
I'm too valuable to be lost at sea.
Hopefully those guns aren't needed.
I abhor loud noises.
Good lord, it's so cold and wet here.
This is why I stay prefer the stations.
My safety is of utmost importance!.
Please try to remember that.
Now that I've seen been on one of these ships, I must say:
I really do not see the appeal.
Stay behind us if there is trouble, sir.
Yes, of course.
Good plan.
Are you feeling okay, sir?
No, but thank you for asking.
I guess it could be worse.
We'll get you there safely, sir.
I hope so.
There was a crawler outside my cabin last night, clawing on the window.
Damn, you should tell security about that. They shouldn't let them come that close.
One of the ventilation pipes in my cabin's crawl space started leaking yesterday.
Did you manage to fix it?
Nah, I'm too old and stiff to crawl down there.
I don't know if it's my arthritis or what, but I don't think I can crawl either.
Why is it always so damn cold in here? Couldn't we turn the heating up a bit?
Uranium doesn't grow on trees you know.
Wear another jacket and stop complaining.
Did a thresher eat your crew? Looking for fresh hires? Look no further!
Need some new crew? Experienced, expendable, whatever you need I've got you covered!
Please hold. Your death is important to us, and a Moloch will be with you shortly.
Ahh, sorry, I meant “please wait for your turn”.
Ever tried Craw-Yum?
When I worked as an assistant that was all I could afford. I hope I never have to touch that shit again.
I don't know, I sort of like it. The occasional toenails and eyes are a bit nasty though.
Did you hear about the raptor race last weekend?
I don't want to talk about it.
I took a loan from some clown to bet on that damn raptor that got itself eaten, and now they've been sending me death threats and coming to my door to honk their horns every night.
Yeah! Not every day you see a race where no-one gets eaten!
I'm not really into sports to be honest, much less raptor racing. I know, they're raptors, but I think it's borderline animal abuse.
Did you hear about that radiation study they've been doing on the surface?
I read about it on The Europan. Grim times.
I've heard some of them are saying we might have to abandon the outposts close to the surface and start moving deeper if the situation gets worse.
Doesn't bother me that much to be honest. If we have to move deeper to hide from the radiation, what difference does it make?
It's not like I was planning a trip to the surface any time soon anyway.
I guess you're right. It still makes me uneasy that we have no idea why the radiation levels are rising or when it'll stop.
I don't really care about all that science stuff. We've got enough things to worry about down here already.
Well, if what they're saying about the radiation penetrating deeper into the ice is true, we might have a couple of extra things to worry about soon.
Ehh. None of my concern, I won't be living long enough to die of cancer anyway.
I'd like to visit the surface some day.
I had to go up there to do some maintenance on one of the observation stations a few years back.
That really was something. You can't even imagine how big the sky is until you've seen it.
Sounds amazing. It's a shame it's so hard to get there nowadays. Unless you're swimming in credits I guess.
I have to admit I'd love to see Jupiter, but I'm not that keen on the radiation and cancer part and all that.
Not this shit again. You need to open your eyes!
Ask yourself: have you ever seen this “surface”? Have you ever seen the curvature of the “ice sheet”? Ever wondered why they don't want us to go too high up in the “sheet”?
I know people who have been to the surface.
I know people who say they've had a barbeque with the Honkmother, what's your point?
I give up.
I haven't been feeling well lately. This morning I passed out while brushing my teeth and this weird rash on my cheek has been getting worse.
You don't read The Europan, do you? There was a bit in that “ask the doctor” section that sounded awfully similar.
Uhh, I don't really read it much. Besides, that doctor is a damn joke, I bet I'd be better off without her advice.
You know you just described space herpes, right?
I know, I know. I'm just hoping it's regular herpes or something that's easier to treat.
You may not believe in karma, but personally I think there's some truth in “a good deed a day keeps the doctor away”. And no offence, you're no saint to put it mildly.
Don't even get started with that crap.
Do molochs lay eggs or bear live young?
I don't know. I've heard people talk about molochs pupas, is that the same as an egg?
No idea. The Hubba Pupa mascot doesn't look like an egg at least.
I've never heard anyone talk about moloch eggs, but I'm no xenobiologist.
Oh hello! How are you doing today?
Same old, same old.
Aimless despondency… I also fell down stairs again.
People dry out like dumplings of old women… And those in whom the spark of hope burns slowly, but surely, they die?
Is it daytime? I can barely tell the difference now that they started keeping the lights dimmed around the clock.
Oh hi Mark!
Who's Mark?
Leave me alone.
Fine, thanks, and you?
Good, good.
Nice, nice.
This has been a fruitful conversation.
Have you heard? The husk cultists attacked the courthouse in the capital!
I told you they'd free Jacov!
Which outpost is the capital again?
When was the last time you had something to eat?
I don't even remember.
I tried one of Aunt Doris's recipes two nights ago, and I really don't feel like eating after that experience.
Eat too much and you won't fit inside a diving suit.
Eat enough and you can be used as a depth charge.
What do you think about the outpost design around here?
Well, it's not exactly carved from moloch bone. But it's prettier than a sub, I guess.
Do molochs have bones?
It's just an expression.
I don't know, I feel like I've seen it before.
It's okay, I just wish they added more color.
It's not any less of a tin can just because it doesn't move.
I'm just so happy to finally have some leg room, I don't really care!
Is it just me or is the sound of water really loud here?
Are you sure you're not just hearing things?
Hell of a mudraptor race the other night!
I think that racing mudraptors is cruel.
Well the jockey of the mudraptor I bet on got eaten, so I'll agree with you on that point.
Do you think we should get some plants around here?
Uh, we just got rid of a nasty ballast flora infestation. Now you want to introduce more biological organisms here?
What is it with you and plants? Your job must be too easy if you've got that sort of time on your hands.
This place is cold and damp all the time. I hate it.
We should complain to the station manager about the conditions.
I bet we'd end up getting sent some place worse if we did that.
I had the strangest dream just before - I was a god or something...
The crew module needs cleaning, your holiness. Get to it.
The reactor's been acting weird lately.
Write it up and I guess someone'll eventually get around to taking a look, hopefully before we get irradiated.
What's up with all the clowns lately?
As if it isn't awful enough down here as it is.
The Jupiter's Ascent parade will be soon!
I hear it'll be a good one this time around. Can't wait to get some of that delicious fried tiger thresher!
…and then I said to the medic: “That's not a tentacle!”
Uggh, you're nasty!
Whoever designed this place has no idea what they're doing.
I know right? It's not wheelchair accessible either.
I know right? Feels like someone just randomly welded together a bunch of room modules and called it a day.
Did you see the sub that came in last week?
The Triumphator? Torn to hell she was. The engineers who patched her up found a mudraptor still alive in one of the gashes on her hull.
Yep. I saw them taking 4 bodies in duffel bags off her too. Apparently something got inside and went to town on them.
The worst part is how cold the captain was... he just hired a couple of new guys and got right back on his way, as if nothing at all had happened.
I get the feeling we won't see them alive again.
The Compensator? That's got to be the weirdest shape for a submarine I've ever seen.
The vending machines here have the best food. Those algae protein cakes are so good!
They taste as much like dirt as the algae protein cakes from any other vending machine I've ever received a ration from.
You don't know anything about fine dining.
It'd be a real shame if there was a fire here, a lot of people could get hurt real bad.
What are you saying?
I'm real cold and I'm not sure when I’m going to need to warm up somehow.
Keep it together, and try not to burn me alive, at least.
I think all molochs are friendly and only want to hug cute subs.
I personally welcome all octopus-like creature overlords.
The water sure is cloudy today.
The weather's so nice today. No currents, clear waters... I might go poppy picking later.
Do you ever wonder who first thought to use a screwdriver as a shiv?
What do I have to do to get transferred out of here?
Station life is dull but I’ll take it over going out on a sub any day.
I wonder what the canteen vending machine will be serving today.
Is that fried thresher I smell?
Someone’s probably just overloading the grid again.
If you could afford your own shuttle, which model would you get?
I always considered the Bunyip a force of natural selection. The best sailors return.
Our previous captain sometimes made us perform what he called the “kamikaze dive manoeuvre”.
“Everything is a ballast if you're brave enough”, he'd say.
Sadly, he's no longer with us. I think he may have been a bit too brave for his own good.
Nice to see a friendly face! We don't get too many visitors around these parts.
Oh, we've got visitors again.
Hi there!
Hello there! You look like you've had a rough trip.
Hello! Welcome to our humble abode.
You people look like you could use some rest.
I haven't seen you people before.
That's a pretty sub you've got down there!
I hope you people aren't planning on staying for long. Got enough problems down here as it is.
Hello there. I hope you won't cause any trouble.
I'll be keeping an eye on you.
Don't cause any trouble.
Hey, you! Get the hell out of here!
You people aren't welcome here.
Some nerve you have, showing your face here again.
You shouldn't have come here...
Always nice to see you people!
Ah, it's you! Welcome!
Hello! Glad to see you here.
Please, let me go!
I can't take this anymore!
I need to get out of here... I'm begging you!
Let's make a deal, let me go and I won't tell anyone what you guys are doing here!
I'm not going to make it out of here alive, am I?
You picked the wrong outpost to dock at, pal...
That sub you've got down there looks damn fine... I think we'll keep it!
Ahh, fresh meat!
This place belongs to us now, and we don't take kindly to trespassers...
You should have stayed away!
I think I heard something.
Probably just the wind.
What's wind?
Ha ha, very funny.
Did something just dock here?
I think I'd have noticed if a sub had have docked.
It's true, docking a sub isn't the quietest operation.
It's so cold in here.
Shut up and save your energy.
If the Coalition decides to pay us visit, we're screwed.
They can't kill us all.
Do you have an idea what they do to outposts like ours?
You're probably right
I've heard stories about them nuking whole outposts just to make a statement.
Sometimes I wonder how long it'll take before the Coalition shows up to reclaim this place...
They won't. As long as that thing from the abyss is wreaking havoc around these parts, they're not gonna bother coming here.
I know, but what'll happen when that monster is gone?
I say let 'em try. We've got enough guns to keep those fuckers out.
I'm starving.
Yeah, we all are.
You know, I'm starting to think it was a good idea to bag those bodies instead of throwing them out the airlock...
That's fucked up. I don't wanna hear more.
You're not the only one, but I really hope we're not gonna have to go down that route...
I can feel the radiation prickling my skin.
The Jovian radiation in this area is way too strong for us to be here.
There's a copper taste in my mouth and I have a hell of a headache.
The radiation is going to kill us if we don't move on.
I hope it's not already too late...
I'm seeing white flashing lights when I close my eyes!
Me too, it's the radiation affecting our eyes.
That doesn't sound good.
No way, you're just trying to scare me...
